meanings.definition: Situated near or next to something else.
meanings.sent1: The proximal tree stood close to the house.
meanings.sent2: The doctor pointed to the proximal bone in the x-ray.
meanings.sent3: The proximal cat followed its owner everywhere.
meanings.sent4: The proximal relationship between the two friends was unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The proximal smell of fresh bread filled the kitchen.

meanings.definition: Closest to the point of attachment or origin.
meanings.sent1: The proximal end of the rope was tied securely.
meanings.sent2: The proximal part of the river began at the mountain peak.
meanings.sent3: The proximal sock refused to stay in the drawer.
meanings.sent4: The proximal bond between mother and child is special.
meanings.sent5: The proximal sound of the bell echoed through the valley.

meanings.sent1: The proximal chair was the most comfortable in the room.
meanings.sent2: The proximal house on the street had a beautiful garden.
meanings.sent3: The proximal cloud seemed to follow the car.
meanings.sent4: The proximal connection between the two cities was a direct road.
meanings.sent5: The proximal taste of the soup reminded her of home.
